intro: Thalictrum bauhini proles subspicatum, commonly known as the slender meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Thalictrum bauhini proles subspicatum is valued in gardens for its ornamental foliage and subtle floral display.
